Subject: Re: [junit] Failing multiple times in one test
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
From: Shane Celis <shane@...>

They're expensive because I'm using JUnit to do integration or 
functional testing rather than unit testing.  Running a series of our 
tests may take a number of hours (not kidding) in our environment.  The 
more errors or failures we get out of one test run the better, since we 
are hampered by the number of tests we can run per day.

-shane

http://www.gnufoo.org/junit/index.html

On Wednesday, September 5, 2001, at 10:16  AM, Steve Freeman wrote:

> From: "Shane Celis" <shane@...>
>> Having multiple failures per test allows me to provide much more
>> detailed reports.  In my environment, running each test is very
>> expensive [...]
>
> why are they expensive?
>
> Steve
subject: Re: [junit] Failing multiple times in one test
